9BF856E2EA584B9985AD4382A68F4B48.description:
Explore the competitive events related to the content of this course and the required
competencies, skills, and knowledge for each related event for individual, team, and
chapter competitions.

6ACD5D3B85384B1E9C6C1A174FDCABBD.description:
Explain how participation in career and technology education student organizations can
promote lifelong responsibility for community service and professional development.

47B508CDB08046E1BEE693AB94626B5D.description:
Explore the local, state, and national opportunities available to students through
participation in related student organizations (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA) including but not
limited to conferences, competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other student
organization activities.

8A14E88C56204B0A8EE79B90BAA179C4.description:
Explore the impact and opportunities a student organization (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA)
can develop to bring business and education together in a positive working relationship
through innovative leadership and career development programs.

2DB3A4D4C53846E1AB57F760E0C01E6E.description:
Explain the goals, mission, and objectives of Future Business Leaders of America
(FBLA) and/or Technology Student Association (TSA) and/or SkillsUSA.

AB9CB21C153644D88A2DD77E9BCDAC9D.description:
Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology
education courses through leadership development, school and community service
projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

871FD11388774E80BBFABACD9D43DA4F.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of current applications of steganography to include concealed
identification, authentication, and communications.

0907652CABBD4DC6B947A70FEA05B163.description: Demonstrate basic cipher systems (e.g., Caesar cipher, Vigenere cipher)

61B20D712E1A41BBBA9610095EA5274A.description:
Summarize general cryptography concepts (symmetric encryption, asymmetric
encryption). [NICE 27]

3D9D7BF3F659482690212B9304ECC920.description: Research and explore basic principles of cryptology

7D48395624AF4ED6A8B6949EFA15C45D.description: Manage user accounts, including basic to advanced protocol procedures.

A67BA34BEA184DB59CAF41D7AA387050.description: Implement appropriate security controls when performing account management.

2463A24681634BA4B34F46A93DBFA097.description:
Explain the fundamental concepts and best practices related to authentication,
authorization, and access control.

A2AACC8AE652462B899DB933AB6F85AD.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of host/network access controls (e.g., access control list) to
include the function and purpose of authentication services. [NICE 49]

D92FE1D706BA4E798D586D098BEC0D7F.description: Demonstrate how to monitor proper access controls and identity management

3F5EB046C829401483D22CF8E4F7FB40.description: Secure DNS/BIND, web, email, messaging, FTP servers.

4804F3958D124F2B8438A8CA9288C74A.description: View and edit Windows services (disable services)

C620398C09F3487786BAB73078C04A99.description: Set up shared documents and folders

0BE069ED32BA4731A9833361F6A79DDB.description:
Demonstrate the ability to select and set both file and folder permissions in Windows
and Linux

0E7E130B06F843F497087918ABA1D83B.description:
Methodically examine and conduct a security audit to review system performance and
settings in Windows and Linux.

E8C2F48FB25B4161AF6480C16C6704C6.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of data backup, types of backups (e.g., full, incremental), and
recovery concepts and tools such as Microsoft (MS) Backup/Restore. [NICE 29]

08FC5013ED23460E8B049B090CD3C304.description: Analyze security using Microsoft Baseline Security Analyzer (MBSA)

22C313DE781444E6BA5CE1780DD2DE9A.description: Establish a secure baseline for host OS.

663A55ABCA1F46AD9FAB9A661E773533.description: Explain the differences between system purposes, such as production system, QA

63E4E290202940D0BC4DFE92C20F8251.description: Secure operating systems (OS), user profiles, and computer permissions.

52082EDA2CF847C690E7139B9995ED09.description: Implement appropriate procedures to establish host security.

FE24E5E45F53455E840C77D87890BFBD.description: Demonstrate how to implement proper security administration.

AA9FBD8FD1234FE1B385E3DBA787D43F.description: Justify the need for and implement secure cookies.

CB78330F61F2426FAA82516B4C1AB7F8.description: Recognize, mitigate, and prevent input validation attacks and scripting attacks.

0E10830F3D124775937A220C0EB880A7.description: Discuss protection from buffer overflow attacks

CD1B542CCB424CA883AE62F6EE852A9D.description: Justify the need and implement Active X and Java Security

D97D03E47E724A7786EDD25D2C9A5A7E.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of what constitutes a network attack and the relationship to
both threats and vulnerabilities and how to differentiate between types of application
attacks. [NICE 150]

636769DED04D48AC8FBD96C159EF9EEF.description: Perform command line exercises specific to operating systems.

17517E20F1B246BB9A80478D92EBAE42.description: Install, configure, and maintain (patch) anti-virus software.

9E26580DF9FD46D087C0A956F89D690D.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of system and application security threats and vulnerabilities
(e.g., buffer overflow, mobile code, cross-site scripting, Procedural
Language/Structured Query Language [PL/SQL] and injections, race conditions, covert
channel, replay, return-oriented attacks, malicious code). [NICE 105]

DC2FEB039E6041138794EAB87E910DB2.description: Explain the importance of application security

BE4DE39D5F38460BB4FD43D67BCE66B1.description:
Demonstrate how to protect them by locking them down with a File Integrity Monitor,
such as Carbon Black

05251D67EEF447128F6A7E4202464A44.description: Compare and contrast common file systems.

23BE39BBAC97448FADFD69EBC0D94612.description: Compare and contrast common operating systems, e.g., Windows, Linux, OS X.

B04A9BEB2441459A83919D71C4AA0C35.description: Demonstrate how to employ host system and application security.

BC1EC24E39274081B43E311C6884A8B0.description:
Design a basic secure network topology demonstrating knowledge of intrusion
detection methodologies and techniques for detecting host- and network-based
intrusions via intrusion detection technologies. [NICE 66]

CA57B01D23424BA6A8A107FEDDA16324.description:
Justify the use of basic Windows or Linux commands to configure communications
(e.g., ipconfig/ifconfig).

C95A602C97514928B19356BED64EF944.description: Configure secure network connections (in Windows or Linux).

5AF853990C3A4D7D9528FB617617CB4F.description: Distinguish and differentiate between network design elements and compounds.

7AF2ECE6816642D8B46EA437BA1F934F.description:
Explain the security function and purpose of network devices and technologies (e.g.,
Intrusion Detection System (IDS) tools and applications and IDS hardware and
software, including open-source tools, and their capabilities. [NICE 3, 59 and 146]

B2576B2D600A42278DCA8802DE753AF3.description:
Demonstrate how to work with fundamental components of cybersecurity.
8.1 Explain the security function and purpose of network devices and technologies

6B45CFB383234361B0FE3AA872EA2A8A.description:
Explain other perimeter devices and zones, such as proxy servers, internet content
filters, Network Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS), Network Intrusion Prevention
Systems (NIPS), and Demilitarized Zones (DMZ).

2B95729667994F41B7CFB162739542AF.description:
Explain firewalls and how to initiate port scans on them to see whether they are locked
down and what it means if they are.

5201B82A01284CF49C9153A1B30D1C69.description: Demonstrate how to set up a virtual private network (VPN).

FE4E477C40514D3FBD407C9489CC1FD7.description: Differentiate between the Internet, Intranets, and Extranets.

D2E879BEA42F467BA5D2BA6A0EA8FDAA.description: Explore and research network infrastructures and network security.

1CEF1FF53BDD4E28A017A2C022B89E7B.description:
Manipulate the Net command in an effort to find out more information about a system,
start and stop services, and work with the network configuration.

4BD833A6C87C4E8ABC7D111469057181.description:
Demonstrate more advanced commands such as netstat, nbtstat, tracert, pathping,
route, and netsh to fully examine a computer and configure it in the command line

86C2C9ADA5464C83A44CA0728AD63194.description:
Demonstrate basic TCP/IP commands such as ipconfig and ping to analyze and test a
network.

5D858EB851B64E0593749E92045B0CB2.description: Manipulate and explain the command prompt as an administrator.

9A247EC5A36A4BA39FCEFA529CD55907.description: Demonstrate how to work with the basic and advanced command prompts.

4EACA9BA47944971A000C37AD0D151F1.description:
Explain the function of Domain Name System (DNS) and Windows Internet Name
Service (WINS) and explain how to install in Windows Server 2008, as well as how to
create forward-lookup zones.

86F75E238A804F26B067240BB9FA0385.description:
Implement Network Policy Service (NPS) as a LAN router and define IPsec and the
various types of protocols, including Security Associations (SA), Authentication Header
(AH), and Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP).

BAC8DB59879441899D175639F8926FC7.description:
Implement Terminal Services so that client computers can connect remotely to a server
and take control of it in the Graphical User Interface (GUI).

08EEB50E34834C3099C8E147F513BC4C.description:
Implement Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) to assign IP addresses to
client computers demonstrating an understanding of the four-step process known as
DORA (discover, offer, request, acknowledgment).

B3FB00DBB4A24BA08250F9C138506AB2.description:
Demonstrate the basics of IPv6 and how to configure IPv6 in the command line and
define dual stack and tunneling technologies.

4F7A19C28456496CA75975B7B7563447.description:
Demonstrate how to define advanced TCP/IP concepts, such as Network Address
Translation (NAT) and sub-nets, and how to create a sub-netted network.

27A33DEDF8BF4642B9AAC28803A7B6AF.description:
Identify the default gateway and Domain Name System (DNS) server and explain how
to configure within a network adapter’s Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol
(TCP/IP) properties dialog box.

B1D60AADCA46480C9428299D95D6353A.description:
Demonstrate how to categorize IPv5 addresses using the Class A, B, and C
classifications.

A24642E87F9D489BABB7C38AAAEE16E8.description: Differentiate between the OSI model and the TCP model.

807C01E4511C42B49866120DE78715D2.description: Explain the differences and operation of layer 2 and layer 3 switches.

904AE58DCA03475A86E91B30D528B58F.description:
Explain the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model by defining each of the layers
and their functions.

6EDE8563FFC545F993EF1066B98532D3.description:
Identify the fundamental principles of the Open Systems Interconnection Model,
Internet Protocol IPv4 and IPv6, and common networking services to include Name
Resolution Techniques.

A8D4453CF5FA47239653A8C1EFC82019.description: Explain different personal and small business Internet connectivity types.

3D25B2957B0244B3AA3A5B9E1C29695F.description: Explain the basics about various other wide area networking technologies

1ABDA5268807455C8EF6D0D7679882A6.description:
Explain how to install and configure Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS) to
function as a network router and how to install the Routing Information Protocol.

F511FFE39FF041519DC07D8960F69AEC.description: Explain the differences between static and dynamic routing

B4F8A0D0D8FC4403B9C21A6B56CD9763.description:
Identify wireless devices, wireless settings and configurations, wireless standards, and
encryption protocols.

5D979F03C40D41DCB8C1E50EB7EED23D.description:
Identify the different network topologies to include client/server and peer-to-peer
distributed networks

92574115617147E4A4CD5591B9F459B6.description: Identify and describe the purpose for a perimeter network

060779776B894A4B92A93E4F89D37CE1.description: Define and identify the different types of LANs

D888018A1B2541ECBD51F16BB8EC6296.description:
Identify the fundamental principles of networking (wired and wireless), local area
networks (elements, perimeter networks, IP addressing, access methods and
topologies), client-server and peer-to-peer networking models, and wide area
networks.

85B452DD964D4AE5807A52DBDACBAE1D.description: Explain the importance of physical security.

CF01BE3B0CED4DC09285C790EF64407A.description:
Research current events on breaches; focus on particular Information Assurance (IA)
areas that were compromised. [NICE 165]

A2D1DD135F424AFE9CF0EEAF23386AAD.description: Explain the concepts of confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, and nonrepudiation. [NICE 63]

A83AC439A2064447BB94C42032797752.description:
Explain the importance of data security and data classification (confidential, sensitive,
etc.).

D0F5681DD7454B3885DA26EC7597BEC5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of cybersecurity concepts and research.

6F6BCF24D50E447898BB76E6100D3D31.description:
Identify and upload additional industry-appropriate artifacts reflective of mastered skills
throughout this course. Write and include a reflective entry for each artifact discussing
steps taken, problems encountered and how they were overcome, and other pertinent
information about the learning.

1BD3D30D430545F29991615CABDD99CF.description:
Review and revise existing artifacts to bring them up to date with new skills mastered,
as necessary.

10FB4E87E5AC415EBD793D6E2F572F36.description: Replace outdated transcripts to reflect current courses successfully completed

87BDDAE5D1ED497AA221563BEA083B84.description:
Compose an additional cover letter seeking employment for a position representative of
new skills, knowledge, and work experience.

D6E4485C7DCB4361970E1E1F254F1691.description:
Review and update résumé to reflect new knowledge and skills mastery and additional
work experience.

0FED5D57EDDD45B2AB71D05519E4D6DA.description: Review and update personal online career portfolio

998252A57DEB4EE58F66BEE68BB2A151.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior, and language.

0F00E984C9E74A3CAE6B0451A4E3AC0C.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to
be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills.

B88857A110D5498F94D49A2F42872F90.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

CA5C91AA9932498AB1283DDAA61EA81B.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem-solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

D1E043AA93DE4420B04DB58558C007A8.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

BFB569F51DB74AFAAD1A6D86F875AD7B.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

95AE5567F07648E59623CF740A013774.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
